post.body: Hello ZeroMe!
Uploading ebooks to ereader. Going to take my first MITx course soon on the End of Nature. As well as a Coursera University course on The Modern and The Post Modern.
I haven't been on ZeroNet for a while because I've been blogging in the #langblr tag on Tumblr.
I'm going back to college this fall after being away for three years. This is going to be a challenge.
Scholarship applications.... Yay. -_-
Time for a Chai latte and foreign language study.

There's a method to the madness of learning / fully understanding a piece of literature. ...

- Read the synopsis on two different sites. (Shmoop & SparkNotes are good).

- Read the Character overviews.

- Read the book and pause at every section to make a note of the general theme. Write in on the page in the book.

- Underline anything that resonates with you or could be useful later.

- After every chapter summarize it on a post-it and put it in the book.

- When finished reading the book. Try to summarize what the main points of the story were.

- Read literary criticism about the book.

- Write something about it.
Currently Reading: "Things Fall Apart".
Flashcards time...
Bought a ton of used Archaeological Journals and some other books from the library today.
Current Read: "Conversations with Leslie Marmon Silko".
Listening to: The Creative Language Learning Podcast.

2nd Current Read: "The House of the Spirits".

*I'm reading three different books right now.
Mia dorso doloras multe hodiaŭ. Tio estas tago kvar. ... :( #eo
Trying “The Actual Fluency” podcast today.

Current Levels:

Esperanto (Intermediate) <- Current
Swahili (Level 0) <- This Winter
Swedish (Beginning) <- Next Year
French (Almost Intermediate) <- Next Year 
Hebrew (Beginning) <- Current
Got back from my road trip. Cahokia Mounds and Woodhenge were pretty cool. Had a picnic too.
Fixing up my blogs. They look like crap. ZeroNet blog is going in for an overhaul soon.
Working on writing up a memrise course today for an old book I got for Hebrew.
Is it just me or did a heck of a lot of people just disappear from ZeroNet? My feed is completely empty.
Kio estas la vorto por "listening" en esperanto? Mi "listening" al "I Will Teach You A Language" podkasto.
Ho! Esperanto estas en StackExchange! https://esperanto.stackexchange.com
Mi bezonas pli teo tiu matenon. ... Kio estas la teo? Fek!!! Mi ne havas teon!! Mi devas iri butikumi.
I might get a VR set soon. I wonder if I can get it to work on my crappy phone. ...
Go to test out some new podcasts today.
Min is a great looking browser! Wish it was more secure. Then it would be perfect.
I'm tired. ...
It's Sunday, time to get everything done I put off all week.

So. ... I fell down the stairs. ... Bruised my knee, took a chunk out of my wrist. Would have been worse but I caught myself halfway. Otherwise I would have faceplanted and broken several bones. Ouch. Damn carpeted stairs...
Trying out new browsers tonight. I would love to be able to get away from the Chrome Poogle browser.
Going to use Wheatt.com for bookmarks.
WTF! Stop spamming people.
Ok. Using Iridium for my desktop browser. Wheatt for bookmarks. Ditching Poogle while still using Poogle. -_-  Using basketapp instead of Pocket for articles. Freemium needs to burn.
Catching up on my feeds, listening to podcasts, taking Hebrew notes.
Dust: https://vimeo.com/183239997

Imagine alien signals are detected. Here’s what happens next. 
https://aeon.co/videos/imagine-alien-signals-are-detected-here-s-what-happens-next
The weather is so nice today. Almost as if it is a dream after the hell of a summer I had.
Tried out the morning pages thing after being away from it for years. I think I could keep writing. ... Maybe this broke through my burnout? I hope.
It's 61 degrees outside right now. I think I'm going to spend the day outside.
Listening to: Code Swtich, Handling Casual Racism.
Taking a Coursera Course:  Think Again I: How to Understand Arguments.
Testing out IPFS. Here's an image of my current browser. /ipfs/QmaW89ZQBnpmCx9LTXTVeWen6a2ZN37C7VAUjbr64ut5ur

Everything Change: An Anthology of Climate Fiction  
https://climateimagination.asu.edu/everything-change/
I cannot stand iBooks. I use Ehon. But every time I download something iBooks pops up. I hate it. ...So, glad my netbook has linux.

Watching a documentary on Alan Turing and Bletchley Park
and testing out the new Language Transfer Swahili audio's.
My blog crashed down to just a single person seeding it. :( This is what I get for being busy and not writing.
Forgiva seems like an interesting new password manager. ...
Watching an old video of how to use the Michigan Terminal System. Weird. It looks like a typewriter with a telephone attached. ...
Mi jxus trovis esperantisto sur zeronet! Mi ne estas sola!
Got 2 new audiobooks: Hebrew Crash Course & Le Petit Prince.
La suno estas subiras kaj mi bezonas kuiri vespermangxo. Mi bezonas kuiri skvasxo kun herboj. Espereble gxi gustos bone. Mi povas songxi cxu ne? :)
I'm attempting to study stuff but my migraine is getting the best of me.
Mi studas argumentoj hodiaux kaj eble legas "La Domo de la Spiritoj". Eble mi legos iu logiko poste hodiaux, sed mi ne scias. Gix estas dimancxo.
Listening to: How we'll kill all the DRM in the world, forever with Cory Doctorow.
Lecture on Data Transfer with Leased Lines. What a nightmare. ...
How to think, now what to think: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6dluwVks444
Making an X-Mind template for Argument Analysis. Writing the reference guide is taking a while but worth it.
Shit. IPFS crashed on my computer. .ipfs/repo.lock: permission denied. What do I do now? Tried updating. I've got version 0.4.3 but nothing seems to work.

Designed a example version of a BitNation ID card. It still needs a lot of work and this is just a mock design. But I think it's starting to look good. The main issue here is what counts as identifying information. What should be included in such a id? How should it be accessible with technology? 

If you have any ideas, leave them in the comments and I'll see how much I can add to the card.

*This is just a random experiment.

http://localhost:8080/ipfs/QmR25o96ToKCZFCwHBLkL4AbbHGM6XwWvDHTZhnkqp2uuP
How did I end up writing a book? Is it because I have class in 7 days? Is that why I'm productive all of the sudden? Maybe I need more scary deadlines in my future. Apparently they work wonders.
Podcasts and reading all day today. I have 5 days to get all my readings done.
Got one of my last two books read for class. I've got four days to finish the last one. I've got 225 pages left and notes to take. ...

"Your score for Stoic Attitudes and Beliefs is 188

The higher the score, the more Stoic your attitudes and beliefs are. The possible scores range from 36 (very unStoic) to 252 (extremely Stoic) ." 

Interesting. Looks like I've still got a ways to go though. Perhaps Stoic Week will help me get in some practice.
Got 3/4 of all my notes and reading done today. Sadly, I've got food poisoning. -_-
Trying out Orbit for IPFS today. Looks good. I just wish there were people actually on it.

comment.body: I dropped the Coursera Literature course to take a legit Literature course at College. Unfortunately it's an advanced class and squishes a semester long course into half a semester. Ouch!
Then I plan on transferring and working on a Criminal Justice Degree with a minor in History.
Everyone is calling me "Sherlock" now.
My eyes are going blurry from applications.
@Riotpulv: US Scholarships. I've applied for almost twenty so far.
@Wakelain: Hebrew and Esperanto
Scratch that. Things changed. ...
141/1365 words on Memrise "Hebrew Duolingo" deck. I've got a long way to go. But my spelling and typing speeds are improving.
@Riotpulv: I definitely agree! I just finished reading it. :)
@Truth: I've read about seven books in the last two month. But I've used this method with "Ceremony" and "Things Fall Apart".

I've had back spasms for four days now. ...
and working through some more of MondlyLanguages Hebrew today.
For some reason French is now seeming to be easier than Hebrew. It was the reverse a week ago. … Strange.

@ks: I do this all the time and I’m also equally poor in both as well. But it’s a good sign I think. It means our brains at least know what we are trying to say. They just sort of glitch and give us the wrong language.
Going to see if I can join their Archaeological Society sometime in the future.
Mi forgesis la vorto! *facepalm*
*facepalm* in mia kolero, mia forgesis "kie" ne "kio"...

@Sick Bird:  Nur stultulo malamus lingvo. Translation: Only a fool would hate a language.
@Voruman: Dankon. :)
@Flyman: Ok. I figured out how to work magnet links. That's actually pretty cool. Right now, 0 of 0 peers. So, I'll leave it running for the day and see what happens. Thanks!!
@Sick Bird: This doesn't require an answer.
@Flyman: Hmm... Strange. It still shows zero peers. I've been checking it all day.  I'm using Transmission.
I'm going to be the nicer person here and assume you were just misunderstanding me. Esperanto is an international language. Not Native American. I speak it. So what?
@Sick Bird: I accept your apology.
@Sick Bird: I do have to ask though. What do you have against Native American Languages?
@Voruman: :)

@Sick Bird: Ok. But it is possible to learn Native American languages online. There are several tribes that offer lessons and tutoring for free. Mostly for Cherokee and Sioux languages but others are coming up as well.

@Sick Bird: I also do not rely solely on the internet to learn languages. I use audiobooks, old textbooks and books that I can find etc. It's very possible to learn a lot of languages for less than $20 dollars total. You just have to know where to go to learn and find resources.
@Sick Bird: :)

@Firebox: Great. ... Well at this point I have no idea what I'm doing. I'm trying to display a canvas element and Chrome tools just spits out the above instead of displaying the element. Here's the project: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1AuiJEcbkJypVTz6H8jQunGDZVhSh7XYZM/

@Voruman: :)

Watched the 20 min video. That was pretty good. :)

I don't know though. It's Sunday and I'm determined to get the least amount humanly possible done without resorting to television. We'll see.
@Flyman: Never underestimate a bullshit detector. It's invaluable in our world today.   :) Thanks for the link to the poster. I want to get something like that printed sometime.
VICTORY! In case this happens to you, use: rm ~/.ipfs/repo.lock Then attempt to run the daemon again and it will update.
